nameEntry.part: Institute of Sisters of Mercy Australia and Papua New Guinea

biogHist.abstract: The Mercy Heritage Centre Collection is a collection of photographs and memorabilia relating to the Sisters of Mercy, Perth. The collection includes photographs relating to St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage and St Vincent's Foundling Home, the Subiaco Boys' Orphanage and St Joseph's Catholic Orphanage for Girls. There is also information about St Joseph's Victoria Square, where some of the girls from the orphanage went to school. Other items relating to the Sisters of Mercy from when they began in Perth in 1846 are also held in the collection.
biogHist.p: Where there are personal items, access is restricted to protect the privacy of individuals. However, most of the photographs are available. You are very welcome to enquire. You are encouraged to make an appointment to visit the Mercy Heritage Centre.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Institute of Sisters of Mercy Australia and Papua New Guinea (2011 - )
St Joseph's Catholic Orphanage for Girls (1868 - 1901)
Mercy Heritage Centre, Victoria Square - Contact Details

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Mercy Heritage Centre Collection', in Find & Connect - Western Australia,

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Building/Ministry. B 1.00 Subiaco/Wembley . Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'Subiaco Dormitory 2' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows a dormitory at the St Vincent's Foundling Home. An approximate date range of 1920s to 1960s has been given, based on the style of the dolls on the beds. It is possible that the picture was taken when the dormitory was decorated for a special event.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Ministry 1.1/1.3 Subiaco/Wembley. Sisters of Mercy. Perth Congregation 1846 - 2011
archref.abstract: 'Guard of Honour Kings Park' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows girls from the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage awaiting a royal procession, which may have been a visit by the Duke and Duchess of Gloucester (1934 and 1945).

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Ministry. 1.2 Subiaco/Wembley. Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2011
archref.abstract: 'Classroom' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows students in the St. Maria Goretti School at the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage. The school is known to have been on site in 1953.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Ministry. 1.4 Subiaco/Wembley. Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2011
archref.abstract: 'Sing song' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows girls gathered around a piano in the hall at the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage. An approximate date range of 1920s to 1960s has been given, based on the girls' uniforms.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Ministry Subiaco/Wembley 2.2 Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'Ballet lesson' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows girls in the hall at the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage. An approximate date range of 1920s to 1960s has been given, based on the girls' pinafores.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Ministry Subiaco/Wembley 2.3 Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'Dancing classes 5' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows girls at a dress rehearsal in the hall at the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage. An approximate date range of 1920s to 1960s has been given.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Ministry Subiaco/Wembley 2.7 Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'Foundling Home 2' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows a group of young children and babies in front of the St Vincent's Foundling Home. An approximate date range of 1914 to 1950s has been given, based on the children's clothing.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Ministry. Subiaco/Wembley. 1.8 Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 -2013
archref.abstract: 'Gardening St Joseph's 5' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows girls working in the garden at the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage. An approximate date range of 1920s to 1960s has been given, based on the girls' pinafores.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: St Joseph's Guard of Honour Kings Park

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Ministry 1.1/1.3 Subiaco/Wembley. Sisters of Mercy. Perth Congregation 1846 - 2011
archref.unittitle: St Joseph's Guard of Honour Kings Park
archref.abstract: 'St Joseph's Guard of Honour Kings Park' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows girls and a sister from the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage awaiting a royal procession, which may have been a visit by the Duke and Duchess of Gloucester (1934 and 1945).

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Building/Ministry. B 1.00 Subiaco/Wembley . Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846-2013
archref.abstract: 'Bishop Salvado and Subiaco' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows a group of adults and children at the southern end of the Subiaco Boys' Orphanage. Dom Salvado was a Benedictine bishop. Benedictines ran the institution from 1872-1876 so the image may date from that time.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Building 1.16 Subiaco/Wembley Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'Girls' dormitory is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows a dormitory at the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage. An approximate date range of 1920s to 1960s has been given, based on the style of the furniture.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Back of St Joseph's main building

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Buildings: 1.05 Subiaco/Wembley. Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.unittitle: Back of St Joseph's main building
archref.abstract: 'Back of St Joseph's main building' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows two girls on a see-saw and some sisters. An approximate date range of 1920 to 1960s has been given, based on the children's clothing.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Buildings 1.06 Subiaco/Wembley. Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1845 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'St Joseph's Front' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. An approximate date range of 1930 to 1950s has been given, based on the car in the image.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Buildings 1.08 Subiaco/Wembley. Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'Early photo' is a digital copy of a photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows the Benedictine Monastery which became the Subiaco Boys' Orphanage (1872-1901) and then the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage (1901-1971). The image dates from 1859.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Buildings 1.10 Subiaco/Wembley. Sisters of Mercy Perth congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'Back area - colour' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. According to information from the Mercy Heritage Centre, the St Maria Goretti classrooms were built in the lower area that is showing in the image. As it is a colour photograph, it is likely that the image dates from the 1940s or later.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Buildings 1.13 Subiaco/Wembley. Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'Orphanage dining room' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows the dining room at the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage. An approximate date range of 1901-1950s has been given, based on the furnishings.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Buildings 1.11 Subiaco/Wembley. Sisters of Mercy Perth congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'St Vincent's Foundling Home' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. As it is a colour photograph, it is likely that the image dates from the 1940s or later.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Building 1.16 Subiaco/Wembley Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'Dormitory 1' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows a dormitory at the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage. An approximate date range of 1920s to 1960s has been given, based on the style of the dolls on the beds. It is possible that the picture was taken when the dormitory was decorated for a special event.

archref.repository: Mercy Heritage Centre, Ministry. Subiaco/Wembley. 1.9 Sisters of Mercy Perth Congregation 1846 - 2013
archref.abstract: 'St Vincent's children 2' is a digital copy of an undated photograph from the Mercy Heritage Centre Collection of Images. It shows a group of young children and babies in front of the St Vincent's Foundling Home. Also present are older girls, who would have been from the St Joseph's Girls' Orphanage. These older girls helped staff and sisters care for the children in St Vincent's. An approximate date range of 1914 to 1950s has been given, based on the children's clothing.
